text: Katherine Vissering "Kitty" Oppenheimer ( Puening; August 8, 1910 â€“ October 27, 1972) was a German American biologist and botanist. She was a member of the Communist Party of America until leaving in the 1930s. She was known for being married to J. Robert Oppenheimer, the director of the Manhattan Project's Los Alamos Laboratory during World War II. Oppenheimer died on October 27, 1972 while traveling in Panama City, Panama from a pulmonary embolism, aged 62. She was played by Emily Blunt in Christopher Nolan's 2023 movie Oppenheimer. ==References== Category:1910 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Deaths from pulmonary embolism Category:American botanists Category:American biologists Category:German biologists Category:German botanists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American communists
title: Katherine Oppenheimer
